title: What is the most important thing to do after a rape has been committed?
content:
"For you personally, the first decision is the most important, and that is to report it!
We recommend that you find a friend or family member who you can trust who will help support you through the process!
The most important action to take is to first preserve the evidence of the rape. Evidence begins to disappear within an hour, and most of it is gone after just 3 days. If possible, the survivor should report the case without changing clothing, bathing, changing sanitary pads, eating, brushing teeth, urinating, or anything that erases evidence of the crime. If necessary, the survivor should put all clothing including under garments in a bag along with any personal items that may have been touched by the perpetrator to give to the police."
